clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Different Screening Score for Hypoxemic OSA (Obstructive Sleep Apnea) With the Results of a Polysomnography (PSG)
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Different Screening Score for Hypoxemic OSA

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of different screening score for hypoxemic OSA (Obstructive Sleep Apnea) with the results of a polysomnography (PSG). The different screening score studied are: STOP-BANG, DES-OSA, P-SAP and OSA50.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators should compare the four screening scores (STOP-BANG, DES-OSA, P-SAP and OSA50) with the results of the PSG (and in particular the number of apnea and hypopnea index and the probability of hypoxemia).

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the DES-OSA score with previously described scores.
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of the DES-OSA score with the results of previously described scores (STOP-BANG, P-SAP and OSA50).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the four screening scores with results of the PSG.
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the four screening scores collected past day (before PSG - PolySomnoGraphy) with the results of the PSG (especially the AHI: Apnea Hypopnea Index)

arm_group.arm_group_label: All patients for PSG at SLBO
arm_group.description: All patients incoming in the sleep study centre for a PSG. At the arrival the screening score will be recorder. AHI will be recorded next morning after analysis of the PSG.
